comments.text:
Currently when adding new products and/or components, sometimes extra steps must be taken such as the following:

1. Products may require the addition of core security groups and/or the creation of
its own specific security group.
2. Code has to be updated to allow certain groups to be always fileable in any product (%always_fileable)
3. The product name has to be added to the list to allow the tracking/status flags to be visible to bugs in the new product (%cf_visible_in_products)
4. The new security group may need to have a bugzilla account automatically cc'ed on the bug when the group is added.
5. The product may need to have a specific security group designated to be display as a special checkbox in the enter_bug.cgi form (%product_sec_groups)
6. And others I may have missed.

Currently these data structures are in an extension module extensions/BMO/lib/Data.pm which requires that code be edited, committed to BZR, and then an updated to the production servers be scheduled. All this can take some time and cause delays for the group requesting the new product.

We need to come up with a proposal on how to address this issue so that this is more streamlined and less error prone. Possibly storing the different data in the database or some type of config files that can be edited dynamically from the product admin UI. This would of course need to be done as extension code as much as possible.

Thoughts
dkl
